title: GOP candidates weigh in on transgender athlete controversy raised on South Shore
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: GOP candidates voiced support for a Pembroke mom's concerns about transgender athletes in girls' school sports.
Chrissy Nelson alleged her daughter lost opportunities due to a transgender athlete at a track event.
Critics argue Nelson's proposed policy might force transgender boys to compete with cisgender girls, raising fairness concerns.

title: Mayor Wu announces new efforts to restrict ICE in Boston
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu signed an order banning ICE from using Boston city property for immigration enforcement activities.
The order directs Boston police to investigate federal agents who break city or state laws and document criminal conduct.
Wu's directive is a response to recent federal actions in Minnesota and Maine, criticized for cruelty and racial profiling.

title: Sing your praises for Drake with our Maye-inspired crossword and playlist
author: Peter Chianca and Kelly Chan
bullets: Patriots fans are celebrating quarterback Drake Maye with themed activities before the Super Bowl against the Seahawks.
Boston.com offers a Drake Maye-inspired crossword featuring song titles with 'may' and a Spotify playlist.
Playlist includes songs mentioned in the puzzle and additional tracks to boost excitement for Super Bowl Sunday.

title: Robert Spillane: Tom Brady’s neutral Super Bowl pick ‘makes me sick’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Tom Brady expressed neutrality on Super Bowl LX, causing displeasure among former Patriots teammates, including linebacker Robert Spillane.
Brady's neutral stance, despite his history with the Patriots, was criticized by ex-teammate Vince Wilfork on WEEI.
Rob Gronkowski expressed his support for the Patriots, contrasting Brady's comments and emphasizing the team's dominance.

title: Lawsuit against Tesla reveals harrowing 911 call as driver trapped in burning car
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A Massachusetts driver died trapped in a burning Tesla after a collision when electric door handles failed to open.
The wrongful death suit claims the Tesla Model Y's electronic door handles inoperability prevented the driver from escaping.
The lawsuit against Tesla cites 17 similar incidents and notes U.S. and China investigations into the safety of Tesla door handles.

title: The 6 most romantic places in New England, according to Travel + Leisure
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel + Leisure selected six romantic destinations in New England, highlighting Boston Public Garden and Isle au Haut, Maine.
The Mohegan Bluffs in Rhode Island and Ice Castles in New Hampshire are noted for their picturesque and unique features.
Romantic spots include Vermont's Scenic Route 100 Byway and Connecticut's Saybrook Breakwater Lighthouse, perfect for scenic experiences.

title: Pickup left dangling off Zakim Bridge in early-morning crash
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A pickup truck dangled off Zakim Bridge after swerving to avoid a disabled vehicle early Thursday morning.
State Police responded at 5:30 a.m., securing the truck with a heavy-duty tow; no injuries were reported.
I-93 northbound right lane was closed at Exit 19 from 7 a.m. and reopened at 8:10 a.m.

title: 2026 Super Bowl commercials: Watch all the ads from the big game
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Ben Affleck directs and stars in Dunkin' 2026 Super Bowl ad with Jason Alexander, Jennifer Aniston, and Matt LeBlanc.
Amazon Alexa, Budweiser, and Oakley Meta continue trends of celebrity and AI-themed Super Bowl commercials.
Svedka Vodka and Ring highlight AI-driven ads, appealing to pet owners and tech enthusiasts during the Super Bowl.

title: How much does Tom Brady’s lack of support for the Patriots in Super Bowl LX bother you?
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Tom Brady expressed neutrality about the Patriots in Super Bowl LX, stating he has 'no dog in the fight.'
Brady, a Raiders minority owner, supports individuals like New England's Mike Vrabel and Josh McDaniels.
Former teammates, including Vince Wilfork and Tedy Bruschi, criticized Brady's lack of explicit support for the Patriots.

title: Hingham kids revive a lucky tradition on Patriots Way ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Hingham kids gather under the Patriots Way street sign to support the New England Patriots before Super Bowl LX.
The tradition began in 2017, coinciding with the Patriots' Super Bowl win, becoming a neighborhood superstition.
The photo ritual returned for 2026, as neighborhood kids chanted, wore Patriots gear, and posed with handmade posters.
